name: Hotel Gabrielli

reviews.text: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel. It has a great location close to the waterbus and St Marks Square. The room was a good size for the location although needed decorating, its worth paying the extra cost for the views across the water. The Hotel staff were not very helpful, this seems to be the case throughout Venice. Breakfast at the Hotel is dreadful with stale rolls and burnt croissants! The costs for anything in Venice are very high, so if you intend to stay for sometime be prepared!
reviews.title: Great location with fantastic views

reviews.text: Considering the lack of room in Venice and the fact that most hotels are tiny there, I was surprised to see the room we got here. It was HUGE for a european hotel. It was also very well kept and clean. We did have an issue checking in, but the owner who was on the grounds took care of it for us. I loved it and the location was great.
reviews.title: Just Wonderful
Loved the Sandwirth!
reviews.text: Would definately stay there again. Our only complaint was that we were not there long enough. Our room was beautiful with 2 balconies overlooking the water. It was a very classy hotel. The staff was a little stuffy but helpful and they had a very good breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Gabrielli Sandwirth for 4 nights in June as a last minute impulse holiday and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it!

reviews.text: There seems to be a common theme among the reviews in that majority of the rooms are very small, however we did pay that bit extra for a deluxe room. It was very expensive at £1k for the 4 nights, but certainly worth it! The huge room was on the top floor of the hotel with 2 windows over looking the lagoon (see pics uploaded) so it was lovely and bright (with wooden shutters that could be pulled down if the sun was too bright for you). It had a king size bed (2 singles bolted together) 2 wardrobes, a dresser and stool, safe, a table and 2 chairs and our own temperature controller.
reviews.title: Don't believe the web site

likes.disliked: — The staff and general condition of the hotel.

reviews.title: Give this place a miss if you are a woman travelling on your own
reviews.text: The sunken bathroom was also gorgeous! Completely spotless like the bedroom, with 2 sinks, a large bath, shower, toilet, bidet, coat stand and shelves.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As our room was front facing there was quite a bit of noise in the morning and evenings with the Vaporetto's and taxi's docking and banging against each other, but you will get this with any hotel you book along the water front and it actually added to the charm for us.
reviews.title: Try the Gabrielli Sandwirth
Fantastic holiday
reviews.text: Surprisingly as well the stocked mini bar in the room was about the same price as the bar if not cheaper as we were well chuffed by how small the bill was on check out.

reviews.title: Definitely NOT a 4 Star...
reviews.text: The first room we got looked like a Motel 6 with sparse furniture and 60's drapery, and not like the 4 Star description that hotels.com has it listed for. In addition to this, the towel bar in the bathroom fell each time you tried to access it, and the shower area was so small that the curtain stuck to you as you tried to shower! This room was also unbearably loud being that it was situated on the 1st floor fronting an inner courtyard that you were privy to everyone's conversation! It was also located right next to a main passage way that was a short cut from the guest rooms to the front desk and entrance to the hotel. When we could no longer bear the noise we complained and requested a quieter room.

This second room was much quieter, had a large marble bath, two sinks, and not located in a main thoroughfare, and was a bit more spacious. But I would still not rate this hotel as having 4 stars, maybe a 3. The conciege also was not too accomodating, when asked a question, you got the feeling like they were doing you a favor.
reviews.title: Mostly a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And in addition to this, you can expect very hard beds with equally hard pillows, but on nice linens, and a very tiny televison that had two Enlgish news channels. All other programming are local Italian stations.
reviews.title: Awful!
I guess I am use too a better hotel for the money
reviews.text: Lastly, the hotel is situated much more easterly on the hotels.com map than I had expected. It is apparently in a residential neighborhood. This was good that it offered the hotel a quiet surrounding, but it doesn't not shield you from the noisy guests. I would say caveat emptor (buyer beware) and take your chances if you will. It can be decent bang for the buck depending on the room you are given, but definitely a far cry from some of the other 4 Star hotels you see.

reviews.title: Could not recomend
reviews.text: Good location, a 3 minute walk to San Marco. My single room was larger, though still small, than most Italian single rooms. The bar tender, Guido, was very friendly. Their breakfast was very plain, but their restaurant was very good and reasonably priced.

We loved our stay at this waterside gem. We upgraded to a lagoon view (room 325, a corner room) where we could watch all the water activity from our bed. Do this before you arrive! Fabulous view. Our children were two doors down on the side, but they had a spectacular view from their balcony. (We did not upgrade them) The beds are hard, but they didn't interrupt my sleep. The rooms are charming with their own little quirks. Open a door expecting a closet and you might find another sink with perfect lighting for doing your make-up while your husband is steaming up the bathroom.Wonderful little courtyard for breakfast where we could plot our walk for the day. There is afternoon sunbathing with cool drinks on the roof terrace which has a spectacular view; or after dinner drinks on the sidewalk from Santi, the bartender. Santi has all the personality in the hotel. (We did not have dinner at the hotel) There is also a lovely shaded garden in the back for a quiet swing while reading a book. Convenient to all the boats, water taxis, gondolas, alilagunas you could want, the hotel is a two minute walk to St Marks. In the late afternoon, you can have a drink at one of the cafes in the square and enjoy the war of the bands. Splurge and enjoy a water taxi tour with a bottle of wine. A great way to enjoy the charm of the city! Of course there are always the gondola rides as well! We took a boat from in front of the hotel to Lido for a day at the beach.
reviews.title: A Waterside Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the airport, you can take the Alilaguna Rose to Arsenale which is right in front of the hotel. If there are four or more of you, I would recommend tossing in a few extra euros for a private water taxi. (Between 90 and 100 euros) Beautiful boats! Ask him to go down the grand canal. It will set the tone for your whole stay! When we departed a water taxi picked us up from the side entrance of the hotel where Vladimir had already loaded our luggage and wisked us off to the train station. We were sad to leave. Some people might prefer a more quiet location, we loved watching all the activity.
reviews.title: Nostalgic and retro - a lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's going back a little while, I know, but we stayed here in October 2005 completely by chance. We'd booked a room with a lagoon view at La Perla di Venezia for our last night in Venice, but had arrived to discover that there was a problem with overbooking; after lengthy discussion, the management agreed to find us alternative accommodation with a similar view. The Gabrielli came up trumps (and although our departure from La Perla seems to have been a lucky escape, judging from other TA reviews, to their credit they paid the difference in the room price for us because the Gabrielli was about 50 euros more expensive).
reviews.title: Terrible Overpriced Hotel - Definately NOT recommended!

likes.disliked: — Nothing good to say about this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with the Gabrielli - but then, we like those sorts of grand hotels that have definitely seen better days but still have a touch of dignity although otherwise faded or slightly shabby. This was certainly not that bad! Breakfast was acceptable and plentiful (although the coffee was execrable), and the roof terrace was terrific, even in the Venetian drizzle. Our room was large and bright and had a huge gothic window with a spectacular outlook over the lagoon, as well as a wide ledge on which to sit and sip some wine whilst watching the comings and goings on the Riva below. The bed was comfortable and the chandelier a magnificent example of Murano opulence.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the bathroom too, although I can imagine it is not to everyone's taste - probably last renovated some time in the early 1950s, with its black marble walls and green bath and fittings (possibly even 1930s with its Art Deco feel); it was a good size and perfectly clean and serviceable. The shower curtain wasn't quite up to the rest of the room, but we just had a laugh at that! There was also a separate second basin hidden in a cupboard, which came in handy at times.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed in the Sandwirth

description: The 4-star Hotel Gabrielli, a Venetian Palazzo from the 14th century is family owned in the 5th generation. Only a few minutes walk from Saint Mark’s square, the Doge’s Palace, the Basilica of St. Mark and the Arsenale offers a fantastic location on the waterfront and excellent views on the laguna. Inhouse restaurant with venetian cuisine and Bar. Don't miss the roof terrace and the regarden to relax from a busy day. Private boat pier.
